alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 7:41PM EST until January 13 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO NOON EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central and western Maine and central and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 1 AM to noon EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...A weak weather system will bring a period of light snowfall to the region. Although snowfall amounts will be light, travel will still be impacted due to snowfall accumulations on untreated roads. Snow will change over to rain causing a period of slushy roads that will lead to extremely slick conditions. Plan on delaying travel to allow time for road conditions to improve. Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
